name: Anchor Hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I have just returned from a week long staycation in Scotland. We spent our first night in the Anchor Hotel in Tarbert. We received a very warm welcome from Ashley and although our twin room was very small it was perfectly appointed! The hotel was very busy and even though they had a large corporate event going we certainly got plenty of attention from the staff. There were lots of locals in also and it made for a very fun environment. The food in the Seabed Restaurant was lovely as was breakfast the next day! If you are staying in Tarbert please make sure you visit the Loch Fyne Gallery as it is a fantastic shop with lots of excellent art, books, jewellery etc. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely return in the future!
reviews.title: Friendly and Fun

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed a night here and loved it. I thought a bedside light was broken but when I returned from a walk it worked, and at breakfast next morning the explanation that I'd missed the tiny switch underneath was given in a friendly way that didn't make me feel like an idiot. The breakfast was really excellent - scrambled eggs done to perfection with Loch Fyne salmon, plenty of coffee & toast offered without asking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Anchor was the last stop on our week in The Highlands - we were pleasantly surprised and thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay. The hotel overlooks the very picturesque harbour and marina. It has recently been refurbished to a very high standard, and the bedrooms are spotlessly clean, modern and very nicely appointed. The Seabed Fish Restaurant was very busy and had a real buzz about it - there is an excellent choice of freshly caught fish. We wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Very satisfied!
Food and service super
reviews.text: We stopped in Tarbert marina and called in to the Sea Bed restaurant. The food was super and the service very good. Highly recommended especially the Sea Food Platter with small portions of everything from Loch Fyne. Great evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay in the Anchor Hotel. From making our booking until we checked out we found the staff of the hotel extremely helpful, polite and eager to assist us with any requests we had. On arrival we found our sea view room to be very comfortable and clean. The room was more than adequate for two. We understand that the hotel has recently been refurbished and we found it to very tastefully decorated. We only had breakfast in the hotel and it was very good. Overall for our first visit to the hotel we were very impressed.
reviews.title: Very Satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were due to stay here on our way to Islay and then again on our return. However, when we turned up they had double booked and were full despite our having written confirmation of our booking.
reviews.title: Error corrected

reviews.text: The manager did then do everything to rectify the situation. We were offered a drink whilst we were found somewhere else and having turned down the Tarbert Hotel along the road, we were found a room at Stonefield Castle. We did stay on our way back and the manager kindly waived the room charge.
reviews.title: disappointed expectations

reviews.text: The Anchor hotel sits at the harbour of Tarbert on a very pictoresque location. The rooms are situated on several upper floors of the building, whereas bar & restaurant are downstairs.
reviews.title: Lovely & Cosy little hotel, with great dining & superb service

reviews.text: The rooms are very nicely decorated, modern and bright with light coming in from the windows (the scenery outside really is impressive). Every place in the hotel was extremly clean, and well maintained.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC HOTEL

reviews.text: It was the truly kind service, as well as the superb dining at the restaurant that made this little gem of a hotel rise above many others: The seafood is simply divine! At the same time the staff really deserve a pat on the back for all their kind advice & assistance during our stay. I really recommend this hotel to anyone visiting this region of Scotland!

description: Recently fully refurbished to a very high standard, with interior design by Gilded interiors, Edinburgh. We offer 12 en-suite bedrooms, with Hypnos beds, wi-fi, flat screen tvs and most with fantastic harbour views. We have an extensive all day menu, including home made lunches, afternoon teas and fine dining all prepared to a high standard with fresh locally sourced produce wherever possible, seafood a speciality. We offer Scottish hospitality in the 21st Century and will endeavour to make your stay as enjoyable as possible and the first of many. Situated in the heart of the picturesque village harbour setting over looking Loch Fyne.
